Package com.intellij.ide.plugins

Class PluginReplacement

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.intellij.ide.plugins.PluginReplacement
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PluginAware
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AppEnginePluginReplacement

    public abstract class PluginReplacement
extends java.lang.Object
implements PluginAware
    Implement this class in your plugin if there is another plugin which functionality covers functionality provided by this plugin so there is no sense to have the both plugins installed together. This will instruct the IDE to suggest a user to disable this plugin when he downloads the new plugin in Settings | Plugins.

    The implementation must be registered in plugin.xml of the plugin you want to replace: 

     <extensions defaultExtensionNs="com.intellij">
   <pluginReplacement implementation="qualified-class-name"/>
 </extensions>

      • setPluginDescriptor

        public final void setPluginDescriptor(PluginDescriptor pluginDescriptor)
        Description copied from interface: PluginAware
        Called by extensions framework when extension is loaded from plugin.xml descriptor.

        If this method is implemented in a bean class extension point and it also exposes the stored plugin description via getPluginDescriptor method, you must annotate the latter with @Transient to ensure that serialization engine won't try to deserialize this property.

        Specified by:
        setPluginDescriptor in interface PluginAware
        Parameters:
        pluginDescriptor - descriptor of the plugin that provided this particular extension.
